page.title: 18Local History and Industry
page.content: When Stevenage was first built it had to employ lots of people who were moving to the new town. They built an industrial area (on the W. of the town) away from the houses so the houses weren't in a dirty area.The main jobs were in: Engineering (Aircraft & electrical) plastics, printing and publishing, photographic and Government research. More recently a smaller industrial area has been added on the N.E. side of the town. Although a number of firms have been attracted, as with the rest of the country, unemployment has been a problem, and is the highest in Hertfordshire. One of the trends not predicted when the town was built was the large number of commuters travelling to work in London.
